text:
What happens to the T in the word "Fitness"?
We have a vowel or diphthong and then a T.

And then a consonant.
That T is what we call a stop T. So we stop the

air. My tongue goes up into position for the T.
Fit

ness
But instead of T, releasing the air,
I just go into the next consonant. Fitness.

What else?  What about the word "outside"?
Outside. That little stop is the T.

Stop the air really quickly.
Football. Football.

Thoughtful. Thought-ful. What about this one?
Have you heard of "Fortnite"?

Fortnite.
Now there the sound before the T is the R,

okay that's another case. If the sound before the 
T is an R, a vowel or a diphthong and the sound

after the T is a consonant , that T is a stop T.
Can you think of a word with a stop T?
